intro: Veslingia scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed veslingia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a distinctive, rough-textured stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. Veslingia scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
